Text: Tina Heath:  In 1973, she played the title role in the popular children's television serial "Lizzie Dripping" after first playing the character in an episode of "Jackanory Playhouse" in 1972; her character was supposed to be 12 years old, but in fact Heath was already 20 at the time.
Triplets:<Tina Heath
4:
--------------------
Text: Tina Heath:  She also played, in that same year's BBC miniseries production of "Jane Eyre" (1973), the character of Helen Burns, the fourteen-year-old boarding-school girl who is cruelly birched by Miss Scatcherd and who befriends the ten-year-old Jane when Jane is a newcomer to Lowood Institute.

Triplets:<Tina Heath
5:
--------------------
Text: Tina Heath:
Other TV appearances included a role in the BBC's "Play Of The Month: The Linden Tree" by J.B. Priestley in 1974; "Churchill's People" in 1975; Muriel Spark's "The Girls Of Slender Means"; and The Sweeney in 1976.
Triplets:<Tina Heath
